content: the christmas bell is worked in the round from the bottom up using the magic loop technique the bell is stuffed with scraps of yarn and grafted together along the bottom and the top at the end a jingle bell is attached at the bottom and a bow and a leather strap are attached at the top **measurements ** **width ** approx 10 cm \ 4 inches\ **height ** approx 9 cm \ 3½ inches\ **needles ** 3 mm \ us2½\ circular needle / 80 cm \ 32 inches\ **materials ** * 6 g sunday by sandnes garn 50 g = 235 m \ 257 yds\ **or** merino by knitting for olive 50 g = 250 m \ 273 yds\ **held together with** 3 g soft silk mohair by knitting for olive 25 g = 225 m \ 246 yds\ **or** silk mohair by isager yarn 25 g = 212 m \ 232 yds\ yarn scraps for stuffing jingle bell ø = 18 mm approx 40 cm ribbon for bow width 20-25 mm \ ¾-1 inch\ leather handle 24 x 0 5 cm \ 9½ inches x ¼ inch\ difficulty ★ ★ 2 out of 5 see the classification of difficulty here 1 the white christmas bell is knitted in sunday by sandnes garn in the color almond \ 2511\ held together with soft silk mohair by knitting for olive in the color hyldeblomst the blue christmas bell is knitted in sunday by sandnes garn in the color baby blue eyes \ 6043\ held together with soft silk mohair by knitting for olive in the color støvet dueblå the burgundy christmas bell is knitted in sunday by sandnes garn in the color dyp burgunder \ 4372\ held together with soft silk mohair by knitting for olive in the color bordeaux videos related to the pattern can be found on the link below 1 https //www petiteknit com/en/pages/svaerhedsgrad
